DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation of the component position and kinematics after navigated and conventional Total Knee Arthroplasty.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Randomized Trial of Navigated and Conventional TKA
DOC.detailed_description: 1. Component position, kinematics After skin closure lateral x-rays were done in different flexion angles in order to evaluate the kinematic behaviour of the TKA. A full-length standing and a lateral radiograph as well as CT scans of the hip, knee and ankle joint were performed 5 to 7 days postoperatively before discharge. 2. clinical outcome Patient sociodemographic and anamnestic data were collected. The written interview was complemented by the EuroQol questionnaire (release EQ-5D) and the assessment of the patients' functional status (Knee Society Score) one week before surgery and 18 to 24 month after surgery.
DOC.criteria: primary or secondary osteoarthritis of the knee indication to TKA a mechanical axis between 20° varus and 5° valgus signed informed consent previous hemi or total arthroplasty severe instability that could not be treated with an unconstrained, cruciateretaining TKA
